properties.areaDesc: East Slopes of the Washington Cascades
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 5 at 8:34AM PST until January 6 at 1:00PM PST by NWS Pendleton OR
properties.description:
...IMPACTFUL SNOW BEGINNING THIS AFTERNOON AND CONTINUING THROUGH
MONDAY...

.Pacific moisture will overspread the Cascade Crest beginning
this afternoon. Several inches of snow will fall on Snoqualmie
and White Passes late tonight and through tomorrow. Snow
accumulations will be in feet on area mountains. Multiple rounds
of snow for the Blue Mountains starting this evening and
continuing through tomorrow where 3 to 9 inches are expected.
Breezy winds could lead to areas of blowing snow.

* WHAT...Snow expected below 3000 feet. Total snow accumulations
of up to 10 inches. Higher amounts above 3000 feet. Winds
gusting as high as 35 mph. Areas of blowing snow possible.

* WHERE...East Slopes of the Washington Cascades.

* WHEN...From 1 PM this afternoon to 1 PM PST Monday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous
conditions could impact the morning commute.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 1 PM PST MONDAY BELOW 3000 FEET
